text: An overexpression of <extra_id_0> retinoic acid receptor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocks myeloid cell differentiation at the promyelocyte stage

text: Retinoic acid ( RA ) , a vitamin A derivative , exerts a wide range of biological effects related to cell proliferation and differentiation .
The pleiotropic effects of RA are thought to be mediated through specific nuclear RA receptors ( RARs ) .
RARs are members of the steroid / thyroid hormone receptor superfamily and exhibit a molecular structure that possess discrete DNA - binding and RA ( ligand ) - binding domains .

In hematopoietic system , RA and RARs , predominantly <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may play key roles for the proliferation and differentiation of hematopoietic progenitors .
However , it is currently unknown how RA and RARs are involved in regulating normal hematopoietic differentiation .

To make clear the roles of RA and <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the normal hematopoiesis , I have introduced the construct of human <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> hRAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) into murine bone marrow cells with retroviral vector , and selected infected cells with drug resistant marker ( Neo ( r ) ) cultured on the stroma cell line ( PA6-neo ) , and analyzed the behavior of infected cells .
All of procedure were done in vitro .

Most cells infected with <extra_id_0> hRAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> exhibited promyelocytic morphology and were thought to be blocked at the promyelocytic stage in their myeloid differentiation .
Furthermore , these immature cells differentiated terminally into mature granulocytes by adding with RA ( 10 ( -6 ) M ) .
<extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> infected cells were also able to differentiate into mature macrophages in the both of long term culture and IL3 colony .

These observations suggest that an overexpression of <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alone is effective to suppress myeloid cell differentiation and <extra_id_0> RAR alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a crucial role in the terminal differentiation of myeloid precursors .

text: The system described here may serve as a model for studying the the essential genes for differentiation of normal bone marrow cells .
